ref fig 21 row 1 purl ear detail row 2 increase kfb k3 kfb 7sts working on one ear at a time with threaded-up black dark grey or brown yarn row 3 purl i used dark grey embroider three straight sts inside the ear making sure that row 4 increase kfb k5 kfb 9sts the tiny stitches you make at the start and at the end of each straight stitch can t row 5-7 beginning with a purl row work three row stocking stitch row 8 decrease k2tog knit to last 2 sts k2tog 7sts be seen at the back of the ear - ref fig 22 row 9 purl row 10-11 increase repeat last 2 row once 5sts row 12 increase k2tog k1 k2tog 3sts cut yarn pass the cut end through the 3 sts pull up for ear point weave tail end in and out around the edge of one side of the ear towards the ear base join ears to the head pinch the ear at the ear base as if creating a petal shape and work a stitch or two to hold in place then join the back of the ear to the back of the head over-sewing in place securely referring to the photographs for placement -
